law.text: After adjudication, a determination by the court that a child shall be detained pending disposition shall be based on a finding of the court by a preponderance of the evidence that the circumstances surrounding the child are such as to endanger his safety or welfare or that of the community.
law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 350, sec. 96, effective April 10, 1988. --Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 423, sec. 128, effective July 1, 1987.
